profileAlternative.name: Mike Byrd
profileAlternative.headline: Senior SQL Server Engineer at ByrdNest Consulting
profileAlternative.summary:
Former rocket scientist and USAF Fighter Pilot -- now a SQL Server geek. Past opportunities include free-lance technical writer for PC Magazine, Senior Software Manager for government sponsored munitions effectiveness committee, and IT Director for Texas Windstorm Insurance Association (9 years), Currently senior database consultant for several companies. Presenter at many SQL Saturdays in US, Europe, and Australia. Ideal job is sproc and query performance tuning or TSQL instruction

Specialties
SQL Server performance tuning; database (OLTP & OLAP) architecture; trouble-shooting; teaching TSQL (Basic through Advanced).

Video presentations (for local SQL Server user groups or SQL Saturdays) can be found at http://usergroup.tv/videos/category/speaker/mike-byrd

Looking only for part-time or short-time opportunities -- either performance tuning or TSQL training.

Also City Councilman for Sunrise Beach, TX for 4+ years.

positions.title: Senior Database Engineer
positions.description: Senior SQL Server Database Engineer. Specialize in performance tuning and database maintenance. Current in SQL Server 2017, 2016, 2014, 2012, SQL 2008R2, and SQL2005. Presented many SQL Saturday presentations at Austin, Baton Rouge, Denver, Dallas, Houston, Oklahoma City, South Florida, Tampa, Colorado Springs, Phoenix, Gothenburg, Oslo, Bucharest, and Sydney. Currently consulting for several Austin based software companies. Also working up new data architecture and implementation plan for Daughters of Republic of Texas system. Have presented multiple TSQL training courses ranging from Basic TSQL to Advanced TSQL and Performance Tuning in Austin and Dallas. Taught SQL Saturday Precon on TSQL in Dallas.

positions.title: Senior Database Developer
positions.description: Extensive OLTP database architecture and object performance tuning for SQL Server 2008R2 and SQL Server 2005. Implemented and maintained Optim database archiving and data purging scripts.

positions.title: SQL Server DBA Developer
positions.description: Extensive performance tuning, data reconcilation, and database architecture, revision, and updating.

positions.title: Data Warehouse Architect
positions.description: Extensive performance tuning, data architecture, business objects report implementation, and data analysis and reconcilation,

positions.title: Director, Information Technology
positions.description: IT Director for 10 person team supporting claims, underwriting, and accounting departments. Project Manager for new insurance system rated by outside consultants as best they had ever seen. This insurance system was based on SQL Server database using Borland's Delphi as a client server application. Managed project to provide web based policy quote system for Texas insurance agents.

educations.title: The University of Texas at Austin

given.text:
Mike and I were colleagues at Newgistics and although we were not members of the same department, we collaborated-on and executed many projects together. My role as a Transportation Manager required implementing changes to the network, which required changes to business management tools and systems of record, and Mike was a key player in writing the scripts and implementing the code for such changes. During my 12 year tenure at my current employer I've interacted with Mike and many other developers while working on projects and through the process I have never understood the various coding languages, such as SQL, which I've witnessed while collaborating with them. However, this year I decided to take the plunge and advance my data analytics skills by leveraging Mike's experience, and his consulting skills, through the form of a T-SQL mentoring course. Mike helped me to dive headfirst into the world of SQL and gain a fundamental understanding of the language. Mike was very flexible in setting a course schedule to fit my personal needs and we were able to meet twice a week for about 1.5 hours at a time via an online session, where I was able to observe his training tools, demos, etc. and interact at a very personal level with him, along with a small group of classmates. Thankfully, these days I'm able to work in SQL on a regular basis by writing and executing queries as well as interact with developers and actually have a solid understanding of the information we review together. I couldn't say thanks enough... but I'll say it anyway... Thanks Mike!

I have had the pleasure to work with Mike for more than a decade now as both a fellow employee and contractor. Mike brings a world of database expertise to the table that is quite addictive to managers and fellow technical staff. The first thing I did when Mike retired from Newgistics was to line him up as a contractor and keep him contributing to our success. I have now used Mike on more projects than I can remember and he always delivers. I never bring in Mike for the easy stuff. Because of his skill set we use him for some of our most complex SQL projects. Mike has a solid reputation with our business managers and our technical staff and we are always confident he will get the job done. I highly recommend him for SQL training, any SQL development and project management. Just don't use him to much as I still need him.
